bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Andrew Balfour, May 24, 1921

div1.p: Carter's subscription to the Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene should be in his name, not his son's.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Andrew Balfour, May 24, 1921
div1.opener:
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
May 24, 1921.
Dr. Andrew Balfour, Treasurer,
The Royal Society of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene,
11 Chandos St., Cavendish Square, London, W. I.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
A receipt for the annual subscription (ending March 31/22)
for Dr. H. R. Carter Jr. has just been received by me. This sub-
scription should be credited to Dr. H. R. Carter, Sr. --Assistant
Surgeon General U. S. Public Health Service, Dr. H. R. Carter, Jr.--
son of Assistant Surgeon General Carter--having previously sent in
his annual subscription from his new address #301 Woodward Building,
Birmingham, Alabama.
div1.closer:
Very respectfully, Secretary. Address
Assistant Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
2121 California St., N. W.
Washington, D. C.
